recipe.name: Chocolate Mint Gelato
recipe.description: Authentic Italian-style chocolate mint gelato with fresh mint infusion and double chocolate richness

instructions.name: Infuse the Mint
details: Combine milk, cream, and mint leaves in heavy-bottom pot
Heat on medium until steaming but NOT boiling (about 80°C/176°F)
Remove from heat, cover, and steep for 10 minutes
Taste test - if too mild, steep 5 more minutes
Strain out mint leaves using fine-mesh strainer
Press gently to extract flavor, but don't crush too hard
critical_notes: Do not boil the mint - it becomes bitter
Don't over-press mint or it becomes grassy

instructions.name: Add Cocoa and Melt Chocolate
details: While mixture is still warm, whisk in sugar, cocoa powder, and salt
Whisk thoroughly until no cocoa lumps remain
Add chopped dark chocolate
Stir constantly until chocolate is completely melted
Return to very low heat if needed, but don't overheat
critical_notes: Add cocoa to warm liquid to prevent lumps
Don't overheat chocolate or it can seize

instructions.name: Temper Eggs and Cook Custard
details: In separate bowl, whisk egg yolks until smooth
Temper: Ladle 1/4 cup hot mixture into eggs while whisking constantly
Add two more 1/4 cup portions, whisking after each
Pour tempered egg mixture back into pot
Cook on medium-low heat, stirring constantly with wooden spoon
Cook until mixture reaches 82-84°C (180-183°F)
Should coat the back of a spoon - finger drawn through should leave clean line
Remove from heat immediately when temperature is reached
critical_notes: Must temper eggs gradually or they will scramble
Do NOT exceed 85°C (185°F) or eggs will scramble

instructions.name: Chill Hard
details: Optional but recommended: Strain through fine-mesh strainer
Prepare ice bath (large bowl with ice and water)
Place pot in ice bath and stir occasionally for 30 minutes
Transfer to storage container
Cover surface with plastic wrap to prevent skin
Refrigerate minimum 4 hours, ideally 12-24 hours overnight
critical_notes: Don't skip this step or gelato won't churn properly

instructions.name: Churn
details: Ensure ice cream maker bowl is fully frozen (12-24 hours)
Pour chilled base into ice cream maker
Churn according to machine instructions, usually 15-30 minutes
Should reach soft-serve consistency
Should pull away from sides slightly
Optional: Add mini chocolate chips in last 1-2 minutes
Gelato will be soft but should hold its shape
critical_notes: Don't over-churn or gelato becomes too airy
Stop when it reaches soft-serve consistency

instructions.name: Freeze and Serve
details: Transfer gelato to freezer-safe container
Press plastic wrap directly on surface to prevent ice crystals
Freeze for 2-4 hours until firm but scoopable
Before serving: Let sit at room temperature 5-10 minutes
This brings it to ideal gelato serving temperature
Flavors are more pronounced when not rock-hard
critical_notes: Store up to 2 weeks in freezer
Always temper before serving for best texture

mint_intensity: Too mild? Use 40g mint or steep 15 minutes next time
Too strong? Use 25g mint or steep only 8-10 minutes
Pro trick: Tear mint leaves before infusing to release more oils
Never boil mint - it becomes bitter and grassy
chocolate_options: Dutch-process cocoa: Less acidic, darker color (recommended)
Natural cocoa: More acidic, brighter flavor
For intense chocolate: Use 45g cocoa + 120g chocolate
texture_optimization: Denser gelato: Churn until thick, pack tightly (minimize air)
Silkier gelato: Don't rush the chilling phase (12-24 hours ideal)
Prevent ice crystals: Press plastic wrap on surface during storage

storage.notes: Press plastic wrap directly on surface to prevent ice crystals

references.topic: Ice cream science and custard technique
